trans-unit.source: The results I saw here were consistent with those that would have been obtained from most of the COBOL implementations I have ever worked with — USAGE COMP has a significant performance advantage over USAGE DISPLAY and USAGE BINARY-LONG (and presumably the other BINARY-xxx usages as well) perform identically, within the measurement tolerances of the test.

The results I saw here were consistent with those that would have been obtained from most of the COBOL implementations I have ever worked with —USAGE COMPhas a significant performance advantage overUSAGE DISPLAYandUSAGE BINARY-LONG(and presumably the otherBINARY-xxxusages as well) perform identically, within the measurement tolerances of the test.
trans-unit.target: Los resultados que vi aquí fueron consistentes con los que se habrían obtenido de la mayoría de las implementaciones de COBOL con las que he trabajado: USAGE COMP tiene una ventaja de rendimiento significativa sobre USAGE DISPLAY y USAGE BINARY-LONG (y presumiblemente los otros usos BINARY-xxx también) funcionan de manera idéntica, dentro de las tolerancias de medición de la prueba.

trans-unit.source: The return code of the operation is returned both in the <
trans-unit.target: El código de retorno de la operación se devuelve tanto en el <

trans-unit.source: The return code of the operation is returned both in the result argument (any non-edited numeric identifier) as well as in the RETURN-CODE special register (see Special Registers). The return code of the operation will be either 0=Success or 128=failure.
The return code of the operation, which will be either 0=Success or 128=failure, is returned in the RETURN-CODE special register (see Special Registers).

The return code of the operation, which will be either 0=Success or 128=failure, is returned in theRETURN-CODEspecial register (see Special Registers). The directory change remains in effect until the program terminates (in which the original current directory at the time the program was started will be automatically restored) or until anotherCBL_CHANGE_DIRor aC$CHDIRbuilt-in system subroutine (see C$CHDIR) is executed.
trans-unit.target: El código de retorno de la operación, que será 0 = éxito o 128 = fracaso, se devuelve en el registro especial RETURN-CODE (consulte Registros especiales ). El cambio de directorio permanece en efecto hasta que finaliza el programa (en el que el directorio actual original en el momento en que se inició el programa se restaurará automáticamente) o hasta que se CBL_CHANGE_DIR otro CBL_CHANGE_DIR o una subrutina del sistema integrado C$CHDIR (consulte C $ CHDIR ). ejecutado.

trans-unit.source: The return-codes of CBL_GC_GETOPT are:

The returned location data will be in binary form, and will be based upon starting values of 0, meaning that if the cursor is located at line 15, column 12 at the time this routine is called, a value of (14,11) will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Los datos de localización devueltos serán en forma binaria,y se basarán en valores iniciales de 0,lo que significa que si el cursor se encuentra en la línea 15,columna 12,en el momento de llamar a esta rutina,se devolverá un valor de (14,11).

trans-unit.source: The returned result is the userid that was used to login to the system with, and not any actual first and/or last name of the user in question (unless, of course, that is the information used as a logon id).
trans-unit.target: El resultado devuelto es el identificador de usuario que se utilizó para iniciar la sesión en el sistema,y no un nombre y/o apellido real del usuario en cuestión (a menos,claro está,que sea la información utilizada como identificador de inicio de sesión).

trans-unit.source: The returned result is the userid that was used to login to the system with, and not any actual first and/or last name of the user in question (unless, of course, that is the information used as a logon id). It is not the PID or UID numbers but the name associated with the UID under *nix based systems.
The returned size data will be in binary form.
trans-unit.target: Los datos de tamaño devueltos serán en forma binaria.

trans-unit.source: The second can perform an extremely fast search against a table sorted by and searched against a key field contained in each table entry. The algorithm used for such a search is a binary search (also known as a half-interval search). This algorithm ensures that only a small number of entries in the table need to be checked in order to find a desired entry or to determine that the desired entry doesn’t exist in the table. The larger the table, the more effective this search becomes. For example, a binary search of a table containing 32,768 entries will be able to locate a particular entry or determine the entry doesn’t exist by looking at no more than fifteen (15) entries! The algorithm is explained in detail in the documentation of theSEARCH ALLstatement (see SEARCH ALL).
trans-unit.target: El segundo puede realizar una búsqueda extremadamente rápida en una tabla ordenada y buscada en un campo clave contenido en cada entrada de la tabla. El algoritmo utilizado para dicha búsqueda es una búsqueda binaria (también conocida como búsqueda de medio intervalo). Este algoritmo garantiza que solo sea necesario verificar una pequeña cantidad de entradas en la tabla para encontrar una entrada deseada o para determinar que la entrada deseada no existe en la tabla. Cuanto más grande sea la tabla, más efectiva será esta búsqueda. Por ejemplo, una búsqueda binaria de una tabla que contiene 32,768 entradas podrá ubicar una entrada en particular o determinar que la entrada no existe ¡mirando no más de quince (15) entradas! El algoritmo se explica en detalle en la documentación de la instrucción SEARCH ALL (consulte SEARCH ALL ).

trans-unit.source: The sequence in which the characters that are acceptable to a computer are ordered for purposes of all types of sorting, merging, comparing, and processing. GnuCOBOL programs may utilize standard character-set collating sequences (such as that defined by the ASCII or EBCDIC character sets) or programmer-defined custom sequences as specified in the OBJECT-COMPUTER paragraph (section 4.1.2) and defined in the SPECIAL-NAMES paragraph (section 4.1.4).

trans-unit.source: The sign indicator will have a value of a hexadecimal A through F. Traditional packed decimal encoding rules call for hexadecimal values of F, A, C or E ("FACE") in the sign nibble to indicate a positive value and B or D to represent a negative value (hexadecimal digits 0-9 are undefined). Testing with a Windows MinGW/GnuCOBOL implementation shows that – in fact – hex digit D represents a negative number and any other hexadecimal digit denotes a positive number. Therefore, aPIC S9(3) COMP-3packed-decimal field with a value of -15 would be stored internally as a hexadecimal 015D in GnuCOBOL.
trans-unit.target: El indicador de signo tendrá un valor hexadecimal de la A a la F. Las reglas tradicionales de codificación decimal empaquetadas requieren valores hexadecimales de F, A, C o E ("CARA") en el nibble de signos para indicar un valor positivo y B o D para representan un valor negativo (los dígitos hexadecimales del 0 al 9 no están definidos). Las pruebas con una implementación de Windows MinGW / GnuCOBOL muestran que, de hecho, el dígito hexadecimal D representa un número negativo y cualquier otro dígito hexadecimal denota un número positivo. Por lo tanto, un campo decimal empaquetado PIC S9(3) COMP-3 con un valor de -15 se almacenaría internamente como un 015D hexadecimal en GnuCOBOL.

trans-unit.source: The sign indicator will have a value of a hexadecimal A through F. Traditional packed decimal encoding rules call for hexadecimal values of F, A, C or E (“FACE”) in the sign nibble to indicate a positive value and B or D to represent a negative value (hexadecimal digits 0-9 are undefined). Testing with a Windows MinGW/GnuCOBOL implementation shows that — in fact — hex digit D represents a negative number and any other hexadecimal digit denotes a positive number. Therefore, a PIC S9(3) COMP-3 packed-decimal field with a value of -15 would be stored internally as a hexadecimal 015D in GnuCOBOL.

The term

The term ’available screen area’ is a nebulous one in those environments where command-line shell sessions are invoked within a graphical user-interface environment, as will be the case on Windows, OSX and most Unix/Linux systems — these environments allow command-line session windows to exist with a variable number of available screen rows and columns. When you are designing GnuCOBOL screens, you need to do so with an awareness of the logical screen row/column geometry the program will be executing within.
trans-unit.target: El término 'área de pantalla disponible' es nebuloso en aquellos entornos donde las sesiones de shell de línea de comandos se invocan dentro de un entorno de interfaz gráfica de usuario, como será el caso en Windows, OSX y la mayoría de los sistemas Unix / Linux; estos entornos permiten comandos -line ventanas de sesión para existir con un número variable de filas y columnas de pantalla disponibles. Cuando está diseñando pantallas GnuCOBOL, debe hacerlo teniendo en cuenta la geometría lógica de fila / columna de la pantalla en la que se ejecutará el programa.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable (an integer) will be used to define how much memory will be allocated for use in sorting. trans-unit.source: The various 01-level record descriptions for a file description implicitly share that one common record buffer (thus, they provide different ways to view the structure of data that can exist within the file). Record buffers can be shared between files by using theSAME RECORD AREA(see SAME RECORD AREA) clause.
trans-unit.target: Las diversas descripciones de registros de nivel 01 para una descripción de archivo comparten implícitamente ese búfer de registro común (por lo tanto, proporcionan diferentes formas de ver la estructura de datos que pueden existir dentro del archivo). Los búferes de registro se pueden compartir entre archivos mediante la cláusula SAME RECORD AREA (consulte MISMA ÁREA DE REGISTRO ).

The various I/O statements your program can execute are capable of imposing limitations on access by other concurrently-executing programs to the file record they just accessed. These limitations are syntactically imposed by placing a lock on the record using a LOCK clause. Other records in the file remain available, assuming that file-sharing limitations imposed at the time the file was opened didn’t prevent access to the entire file.

The various I/O statements your program can execute are capable of imposing limitations on access by other concurrently-executing programs to the file record they just accessed. These limitations are syntactically imposed by placing a lock on the record using aLOCKclause. Other records in the file remain available, assuming that file-sharing limitations imposed at the time the file was opened didn’t prevent access to the entire file.
trans-unit.target: Las diversas declaraciones de E / S que puede ejecutar su programa son capaces de imponer limitaciones al acceso de otros programas que se ejecutan simultáneamente al registro de archivo al que acaban de acceder. Estas limitaciones se imponen sintácticamente al colocar un bloqueo en el registro mediante una cláusula LOCK . Otros registros del archivo permanecen disponibles, asumiendo que las limitaciones para compartir archivos impuestas en el momento en que se abrió el archivo no impidieron el acceso a todo el archivo.

trans-unit.source: The whole reason you’re reading this is that you’ve discovered GnuCOBOL — another implementation of COBOL in addition to those mentioned earlier. The distinguishing characteristic of GnuCOBOL versus those others is that GnuCOBOL is FREE open-source and therefore FREE to obtain and use. It is community-enhanced and community-supported. Later in this document (see So What is GnuCOBOL?), you’ll begin to learn more about this COBOL implementation’s capabilities.
trans-unit.target: La única razón por la que está leyendo esto es que ha descubierto GnuCOBOL, otra implementación de COBOL además de las mencionadas anteriormente. La característica distintiva de GnuCOBOL frente a los demás es que GnuCOBOL es de código abierto GRATUITO y, por lo tanto, GRATUITO de obtener y usar. Está mejorado y apoyado por la comunidad. Más adelante en este documento (consulte Entonces, ¿Qué es GnuCOBOL? ), Comenzará a aprender más sobre las capacidades de esta implementación de COBOL.

trans-unit.source: The*operator computes the product of the left and right arguments while the/operator computes the value of the left argument divided by the value of the right argument. If the right argument has a value of zero, expression evaluation will be prematurely terminated before a value is generated. This may cause program failure at run-time.
trans-unit.target: El operador * calcula el producto de los argumentos izquierdo y derecho, mientras que el operador / calcula el valor del argumento izquierdo dividido por el valor del argumento derecho. Si el argumento correcto tiene un valor de cero, la evaluación de la expresión terminará prematuramente antes de que se genere un valor. Esto puede provocar fallos en el programa durante la ejecución.

trans-unit.source: The*symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: El símbolo * no está permitido junto con N

trans-unit.source: The+operator calculates the sum of the left and right arguments while the-operator computes the value of the right argument subtracted from that of the left argument.
trans-unit.target: El operador + calcula la suma de los argumentos izquierdo y derecho, mientras que el operador - calcula el valor del argumento derecho restado del del argumento izquierdo.

trans-unit.source: The+symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: El símbolo + no está permitido junto con N

trans-unit.target: El símbolo , no está permitido junto con N

trans-unit.source: The,symbol serves as a thousands separator. Many times, you’ll see large numbers formatted with these symbols — for example, 123,456,789. This can be accomplished easily by adding thousands separator symbols to a picture string. Thousands separator symbols that aren’t needed will behave as if they were9.
trans-unit.target: El símbolo , sirve como separador de miles. Muchas veces, verá números grandes formateados con estos símbolos, por ejemplo, 123,456,789. Esto se puede lograr fácilmente agregando miles de símbolos separadores a una cadena de imágenes. Miles de símbolos separadores que no son necesarios se comportarán como si fueran 9 .

trans-unit.source: The-symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: El símbolo - no está permitido junto con N

trans-unit.source: The.symbol inserts a decimal point into a numeric field value. When the contents of a numeric data item sending field are moved into a receiving data item whose picture clause contains the.editing symbol, implied V or actual decimal point in the sending data item or literal, respectively, will be aligned with the.symbol in the receiving field. Digits are then transferred from the sending to the receiving field outward from the sending field’s "V" or ".", truncating sending digits if there aren’t enough positions in the receiving field. Any digit positions in the receiving field that don’t receive digits from the sending field, if any, will be set to 0.
trans-unit.target: El . símbolo inserta un punto decimal en un valor de campo numérico. Cuando el contenido de un campo de envío de elementos de datos numéricos se mueve a un elemento de datos de recepción cuya cláusula de imagen contiene el . El símbolo de edición, V implícita o el punto decimal real en el elemento de datos de envío o literal, respectivamente, se alinearán con . símbolo en el campo de recepción. Luego, los dígitos se transfieren desde el campo de envío al campo de recepción hacia afuera desde la "V" o "." Del campo de envío, truncando los dígitos de envío si no hay suficientes posiciones en el campo de recepción. Cualquier posición de dígito en el campo de recepción que no reciba dígitos del campo de envío, si corresponde, se establecerá en 0.

trans-unit.source: The.symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: El . El símbolo no está permitido junto con N

trans-unit.source: The/editing symbol inserts one "/" character into the field value for each occurrence in the picture string.
trans-unit.target: El símbolo de edición / inserta un carácter "/" en el valor del campo para cada aparición en la cadena de imagen.

trans-unit.source: The0(zero) editing symbol introduces one "0" character into the field value for each occurrence in the picture string.
trans-unit.target: El símbolo de edición 0 (cero) introduce un carácter "0" en el valor del campo para cada aparición en la cadena de imágenes.

trans-unit.source: TheACCEPT screen-data-itemstatement (see ACCEPT screen-data-item) will ignore the Enter key and any other cursor-moving keystrokes that would cause the cursor to move to another screen item unless the proper amount of data has been entered into the field. trans-unit.source: TheADVANCING PAGEclause will introduce the appropriate number of line-terminator character sequences into the file either before the written record AFTER ADVANCING or after the written record BEFORE ADVANCING so as to force the printer to automatically advance to a new sheet of paper when the file prints. No formfeed characters will be generated whenLINAGEis specified — instead, it is assumed that the printer to which the report will be printed will be loaded with special forms that conform to the specifications defined by theLINAGEclause.
trans-unit.target: La cláusula ADVANCING PAGE introducirá el número apropiado de secuencias de caracteres de terminación de línea en el archivo, ya sea antes del registro escrito AFTER ADVANCING o después del registro escrito BEFORE ADVANCING para forzar a la impresora a avanzar automáticamente a una nueva hoja de papel cuando el archivo huellas dactilares. No se generarán caracteres de alimentación de formulario cuando se especifique LINAGE ; en su lugar, se supone que la impresora en la que se imprimirá el informe se cargará con formularios especiales que se ajustan a las especificaciones definidas por la cláusula LINAGE .

trans-unit.source: TheADVANCING n LINESclause will introduce the specified number of line-terminator character sequences into the file either before the written record AFTER ADVANCING or after the written record BEFORE ADVANCING.
trans-unit.target: La cláusula ADVANCING n LINES introducirá el número especificado de secuencias de caracteres de terminación de línea en el archivo, ya sea antes del registro escrito AFTER ADVANCING BEFORE ADVANCING o después del registro escrito ANTES DEL AVANZADO .

trans-unit.source: TheCHARACTERSoption will match any one single character, regardless of what that character is.

trans-unit.source: TheCHARACTERSoption will match any one single character. When you use this option, the replacement sub string (see the next item) must be exactly one character in length.
trans-unit.target: La opción CHARACTERS coincidirá con cualquier carácter. Cuando utiliza esta opción, la subcadena de reemplazo (consulte el siguiente elemento) debe tener exactamente un carácter de longitud.

trans-unit.source: TheCLOSEstatement may only be executed against files that have been successfully opened.

trans-unit.source: TheCOMPUTE(see COMPUTE) statement will evaluate the arithmetic expressionC-D+1and then save that result inI
trans-unit.target: La COMPUTE (ver COMPUTE ) evaluará la expresión aritmética C-D+1 y luego guardará ese resultado en I

trans-unit.source: TheCOMPUTEstatement supports exponentiation (via the "**" operator) — there is no equivalent basic arithmetic statement. Although you could simulate integral exponentiation (raising a value to the third power, for example) usingMULTIPLYstatements, and you may use theSQRTintrinsic function (see SQRT) to find a square root, there’s just no (easy) way to find the cube-root of a value without using theCOMPUTEstatement.
trans-unit.target: La instrucción COMPUTE admite la exponenciación (a través del operador "**"); no hay una instrucción aritmética básica equivalente. Aunque puede simular la exponenciación integral (elevando un valor a la tercera potencia, por ejemplo) usando declaraciones MULTIPLY , y puede usar la función intrínseca SQRT (ver SQRT ) para encontrar una raíz cuadrada, simplemente no hay una manera (fácil) de encontrar la raíz cúbica de un valor sin utilizar la instrucción COMPUTE .

trans-unit.source: TheEXIT PROGRAMandEXIT FUNCTIONstatements terminate the execution of a subroutine (i.e. a program that has been CALLed by another) or user-defined function, respectively, returning control back to the calling program.
trans-unit.target: Las sentencias EXIT PROGRAM y EXIT FUNCTION terminan la ejecución de una subrutina (es decir, un programa que ha sido LLAMADO por otro) o función definida por el usuario, respectivamente, devolviendo el control al programa de llamada.

trans-unit.target: La instrucción EXIT PROGRAM no es legal en ninguna parte dentro de una función definida por el usuario.

trans-unit.source: TheEXTERNALclause may only be specified at the 77 or 01 level.

trans-unit.source: TheEmployeedata item consists of two subordinate data items — anEmployee-Nameand anEmployment-Datesdata item (presumably there would be a lot of others too, but we don’t care about them right now). As the diagram shows, each of those data items are, in turn, broken down into subordinate data items. This hierarchy of data items can get ratherdeep and GnuCOBOL, like other COBOL implementations, can handle up to 49 levels of such hierarchical structures.
trans-unit.target: El elemento de datos del Employee consta de dos elementos de datos subordinados: un elemento de datos Employee-Name y Employment-Dates (presumiblemente también habría muchos otros, pero ahora no nos importan). Como muestra el diagrama, cada uno de esos elementos de datos se divide, a su vez, en elementos de datos subordinados. Esta jerarquía de elementos de datos puede volverse bastante deep y GnuCOBOL, como otras implementaciones de COBOL, puede manejar hasta 49 niveles de dichas estructuras jerárquicas.

trans-unit.source: TheFOREVERoption will repeatedly execute the code within the perform scope with no conditions defined for termination of the repetition — it will be up to the programmer to include anEXIT SECTIONstatement (see EXIT) orEXIT PARAGRAPHstatement within the procedure(s) being performed that will break out of the loop.
trans-unit.target: La opción FOREVER ejecutará repetidamente el código dentro del alcance de ejecución sin condiciones definidas para la terminación de la repetición; dependerá del programador incluir una instrucción EXIT SECTION (ver EXIT ) o EXIT PARAGRAPH dentro de los procedimientos que se están realizando. realizado que saldrá del bucle.

trans-unit.source: TheFULLclause forces the user to enter data into the field it is specified on (or into all subordinate input-capable fields if specified on a group item) sufficient to fill every character position of the field.
trans-unit.target: La cláusula FULL obliga al usuario a ingresar datos en el campo en el que está especificado (o en todos los campos subordinados con capacidad de entrada si se especifica en un elemento de grupo) lo suficiente para llenar cada posición de carácter del campo.

trans-unit.source: TheGLOBAL(see GLOBAL) option, if used, allows a declarative procedure to be used across the program containing theUSEstatement and any subprograms nested within that program.
trans-unit.target: La opción GLOBAL (ver GLOBAL ), si se usa, permite que se use un procedimiento declarativo en todo el programa que contiene la instrucción USE y cualquier subprograma anidado dentro de ese programa.

trans-unit.source: TheGLOBALclause may only be specified at the 77 or 01 level.
trans-unit.target: La cláusula GLOBAL solo se puede especificar en el nivel 77 o 01.

trans-unit.source: TheGROUP INDICATEclause specifies that the data item in whose definition the clause appears will be presented only in very limited circumstances.
trans-unit.target: La cláusula GROUP INDICATE especifica que el dato en cuya definición aparece la cláusula se presentará solo en circunstancias muy limitadas.

trans-unit.source: TheINSPECTstatement will make a single pass through the sequence of characters comprising the inspect subject. As the pointer to the current inspect target character reaches a point where it falls within the explicit or implicit target ranges specified on the operational instructions of the two clauses, the actions specified by those instructions will become eligible to be taken. As the character pointer reaches a point where it falls past the end of target ranges, the instructions belonging to those target ranges will become disabled.
trans-unit.target: La instrucción INSPECT hará una sola pasada a través de la secuencia de caracteres que componen el sujeto de inspección. A medida que el puntero al carácter objetivo de inspección actual llega a un punto en el que se encuentra dentro de los rangos objetivo explícitos o implícitos especificados en las instrucciones operativas de las dos cláusulas, las acciones especificadas por esas instrucciones serán elegibles para ser tomadas. A medida que el puntero del carácter alcanza un punto en el que cae más allá del final de los rangos objetivo, las instrucciones que pertenecen a esos rangos objetivo se desactivarán.

If used with a sequential file, the organization of that file will be implicitly changed to line sequential. The various components of theLINAGEclause define the layout of printed pages as follows:

trans-unit.source: TheLINEandCOLUMNclauses provide one mechanism for specifying the line and column position to which the cursor will be positioned before allowing the user to enter data. In the absence of one or the other, a value of 1 will be assumed for the one that is missing. The author’s personal preference, however, is to explicitly code both.
trans-unit.target: Las cláusulas LINE y COLUMN proporcionan un mecanismo para especificar la posición de la línea y columna en la que se colocará el cursor antes de permitir que el usuario ingrese datos. En ausencia de uno u otro, se asumirá un valor de 1 para el que falta. La preferencia personal del autor, sin embargo, es codificar explícitamente ambos.

trans-unit.source: TheNOToperator has the highest precedence of all logical operators, just as a unary minus sign (which "negates" a numeric value) is the highest precedence arithmetic operator.

trans-unit.source: TheNOToption reverses the TRUE/FALSE value of the condition.

trans-unit.source: TheSTATICoption will cause the linkage to the subroutine to be performed in such a way as to require the subroutine to be statically-linked with the calling program. Note that this enables static-linking to be used on a subroutine-by-subroutine selective basis.

trans-unit.source: TheSTDCALLoption allows system-standard calling conventions (as opposed to GnuCOBOL calling conventions) to be used when calling a subroutine. The definition of what constitutes "system standard" may vary from operating system to operating system. Use of this requires special knowledge about the linkage requirements of subroutines you are intending toCALL Subroutines written in GnuCOBOL do not need this option.
trans-unit.target: La opción STDCALL permite que las convenciones de llamada estándar del sistema (a diferencia de las convenciones de llamada de GnuCOBOL) se utilicen al llamar a una subrutina. La definición de lo que constituye "estándar del sistema" puede variar de un sistema operativo a otro. El uso de esto requiere un conocimiento especial sobre los requisitos de enlace de las subrutinas a las que tiene la intención de CALL Las subrutinas escritas en GnuCOBOL no necesitan esta opción.

trans-unit.source: TheTERMINATEstatement will present eachCONTROL FOOTING(if any), in reverse sequence of the control hierarchy, starting with the most minor up toFINAL(if any). trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEclause defines the format that will be used to store the value of a data item.
trans-unit.target: La cláusula USAGE define el formato que se utilizará para almacenar el valor de un elemento de datos.

trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEspecificationsFLOAT-DECIMAL-16andFLOAT-DECIMAL-34will encode data using IEEE 754Decimal64andDecimal128format, respectively. The former allows for up to 16 digits of exact precision while the latter offers 34. The phrase "exact precision" is used because the traditional binary renderings of decimal real numbers in a floating-point format FLOAT-LONGandFLOAT-SHORT for example) only yield an approximation of the actual value because many decimal fractions cannot be precisely rendered in binary. The Decimal64 and Decimal128 renderings, however, render decimal real numbers in encoded decimal form in much the same way thatPACKED-DECIMALrenders a decimal integer in digit-by-digit decimal form. The exact manner in which this rendering is performed is complex (Wikipedia has an excellent article on the subject  just search forDecimal64.
trans-unit.target: Las especificaciones de USAGE FLOAT-DECIMAL-16 y FLOAT-DECIMAL-34 codificarán los datos utilizando el formato IEEE 754 Decimal64 y Decimal128 , respectivamente. El primero permite hasta 16 dígitos de precisión exacta mientras que el segundo ofrece 34. La frase "precisión exacta" se utiliza debido a las representaciones binarias tradicionales de números reales decimales en un formato de punto flotante FLOAT-LONG y FLOAT-SHORT , por ejemplo) solo da una aproximación del valor real porque muchas fracciones decimales no se pueden representar con precisión en binario. Sin embargo, las representaciones Decimal64 y Decimal128 representan números reales decimales en forma decimal codificada de la misma manera que PACKED-DECIMAL representa un entero decimal en formato decimal dígito a dígito. La forma exacta en que se realiza esta representación es compleja (Wikipedia tiene un artículo excelente sobre el tema; solo busque Decimal64 .

trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEspecificationsFLOAT-LONGandFLOAT-SHORTuse the IEEE 754Binary64andBinary32formats, respectively. These are binary encodings of real decimal numbers, and as such cannot represent every possible value between the minimum and maximum values in the range for those usages. Wikipedia has an excellent article on the Binary64 and Binary32 encoding schemes  just search onBinary32orBinary64
trans-unit.target: Las especificaciones de USAGE FLOAT-LONG y FLOAT-SHORT utilizan los formatos IEEE 754 Binary64 y Binary32 , respectivamente. Estas son codificaciones binarias de números decimales reales y, como tales, no pueden representar todos los valores posibles entre los valores mínimo y máximo en el rango para esos usos. Wikipedia tiene un artículo excelente sobre los esquemas de codificación Binary64 y Binary32; solo busque en Binary32 o Binary64

trans-unit.source: There are three possible brightness levels supported for text — lowlight (dim), normal and highlight (bright). Not all GnuCOBOL implementations will support all three (some treat lowlight the same as normal). The deciding factor as to whether two or three levels are supported lies with the version of the

There are three possible brightness levels supported for text — lowlight (dim), normal and highlight (bright). Not all GnuCOBOL implementations will support all three (some treat lowlight the same as normal). The deciding factor as to whether two or three levels are supported lies with the version of the "curses" package that is being used. This is a utility screen-IO package that is included into the GnuCOBOL run-time library when the GnuCOBOL software is built.
trans-unit.target: Hay tres posibles niveles de brillo admitidos para el texto: poca luz (tenue), normal y resaltado (brillante). No todas las implementaciones de GnuCOBOL admitirán las tres (algunas tratan la luz baja de la misma manera que lo normal). El factor decisivo en cuanto a si se admiten dos o tres niveles reside en la versión del paquete "curses" que se esté utilizando. Este es un paquete de IO de pantalla de utilidad que se incluye en la biblioteca de tiempo de ejecución de GnuCOBOL cuando se crea el software GnuCOBOL.

trans-unit.source: There have been programming languages designed specifically for the processing of text strings, and there have been programming languages designed for the sole purpose of performing high-powered numerical computations. Most programming languages fall somewhere in the middle.

There is never an issue of exactly what the length of a string contained in a USAGE DISPLAY (see USAGE) data item is — there are always exactly how ever many characters as were allowed for by the PICTURE clause. In the example above, LastName will always contain exactly fifteen characters; of course, there may be anywhere from 0 to 15 trailing SPACES as part of the current LastName value.

There is never an issue of exactly what the length of a string contained in aUSAGE DISPLAY(see USAGE) data item is — there are always exactly how ever many characters as were allowed for by thePICTUREclause. In the example above, "LastName" will always contain exactly fifteen characters; of course, there may be anywhere from 0 to 15 trailing SPACES as part of the current LastName value.
trans-unit.target: Nunca hay un problema de cuál es exactamente la longitud de una cadena contenida en un elemento de datos de USAGE DISPLAY (ver USO ); siempre hay exactamente cuántos caracteres permitidos por la cláusula PICTURE . En el ejemplo anterior, "Apellido" siempre contendrá exactamente quince caracteres; por supuesto, puede haber entre 0 y 15 ESPACIOS finales como parte del valor actual de Apellido.

trans-unit.source: There may be times where this is exactly what you were looking for. More often than not, however, this is not desirable behaviour. Suggestion: use a copybook to describe the record layouts of any file; this guarantees that multiple programs accessing that file will "see" the same record sizes and layouts by coding aCOPYstatement (see COPY) to import the record layout(s) rather than hand-coding them.
trans-unit.target: Puede haber ocasiones en las que esto sea exactamente lo que estaba buscando. Sin embargo, la mayoría de las veces, este comportamiento no es deseable. Sugerencia: use un cuaderno para describir los diseños de registro de cualquier archivo; esto garantiza que varios programas que accedan a ese archivo "verán" los mismos tamaños de registro y diseños al codificar una instrucción COPY (ver COPY ) para importar los diseños de registro en lugar de codificarlos manualmente.

There will be multiple structures stored for an INDEXED file. The first will be a data component, which may be thought of as being similar to the internal structure of a relative file. Data records may not, however, be directly accessed by their record number as would be the case with a relative file, nor may they be processed sequentially by their physical sequence in the file.

There will be multiple structures stored for anINDEXEDfile. The first will be a data component, which may be thought of as being similar to the internal structure of a relative file. Data records may not, however, be directly accessed by their record number as would be the case with a relative file, nor may they be processed sequentially by their physical sequence in the file.
trans-unit.target: Habrá varias estructuras almacenadas para un archivo INDEXED . El primero será un componente de datos, que puede considerarse similar a la estructura interna de un archivo relativo. Sin embargo, no se puede acceder directamente a los registros de datos por su número de registro, como sería el caso con un archivo relativo, ni pueden ser procesados ​​secuencialmente por su secuencia física en el archivo.

trans-unit.source: There’s no reason that user-defined functions cannot be included too — they’ll just have FUNCTION-IDs and will be ended by END FUNCTION markers.
There’s no reason that user-defined functions cannot be included too — they’ll just haveFUNCTION-ID and will be ended byEND FUNCTIONmarkers.
trans-unit.target: No hay ninguna razón por la que las funciones definidas por el usuario no se puedan incluir también; solo tendrán FUNCTION-ID y terminarán con los marcadores END FUNCTION .

trans-unit.source: These are alphanumeric literals whose character sequence is specified by hexadecimal value. These literals are formed by a quote- or apostrophe-delimited sequence of an even number of hexadecimal digits (upper- or lower-case), prefixed with the letter "X" (also upper- or lower-case). For example, the character string "Demo" could be specified as the hexadecimal alphanumeric literalX'44656D6F' assuming the ASCII character set. See Alphanumeric Literals.
trans-unit.target: Se trata de literales alfanuméricos cuya secuencia de caracteres se especifica mediante un valor hexadecimal. Estos literales están formados por una secuencia delimitada por comillas o apóstrofos de un número par de dígitos hexadecimales (mayúsculas o minúsculas), precedidos de la letra "X" (también mayúsculas o minúsculas). Por ejemplo, la cadena de caracteres "Demo" podría especificarse como el literal alfanumérico hexadecimal X'44656D6F' asumiendo el juego de caracteres ASCII. Consulte Literales alfanuméricos .

trans-unit.source: These are alphanumeric literals whose character sequence is specified by hexadecimal value. These literals are formed by a quote- or apostrophe-delimited sequence of an even number of hexadecimal digits (upper- or lower-case), prefixed with the letter ‘

These are data items a COBOL program will be working with. The vast majority of identifiers are defined by the user (programmer) while a few are pre-defined by the GnuCOBOL compiler. Identifiers pre-defined by the compiler are referred to as special registers. Other programming languages generally refer to identifiers as "variables".
trans-unit.target: Estos son los datos con los que trabajará el programa COBOL.La gran mayoría de los identificadores son definidos por el usuario (programador)mientras que unos pocos están predefinidos por el compilador GnuCOBOL.Los identificadores predefinidos por el compilador se denominan registros especiales.Otros lenguajes de programación se refieren generalmente a los identificadores como "variables".

trans-unit.source: These are data items a COBOL program will be working with. The vast majority of identifiers are defined by the user (programmer) while a few are pre-defined by the GnuCOBOL compiler. Identifiers pre-defined by the compiler are referred to as special registers. Other programming languages generally refer to identifiers as “variables”.
These are dynamically-loadable object code files ready to be invoked from other programs at execution time. On Windows systems, these would be

These are dynamically-loadable object code files ready to be invoked from other programs at execution time. On Windows systems, these would be ".dll" files, while on Unix systems they are typically ".so" files (OSX uses ".dylib").
trans-unit.target: Estos son archivos de código objeto cargables dinámicamente listos para ser invocados desde otros programas en tiempo de ejecución.En los sistemas Windows,estos serían archivos ".dll",mientras que en los sistemas Unix son típicamente archivos ".so" (OSX usa ".dylib").

trans-unit.source: These are files with an internal structure similar to that of a line sequential file. These files are defined (without an explicit ORGANIZATION specification) using the LINE ADVANCING clause on their SELECT statement (see SELECT).

These are files with an internal structure similar to that of a line sequential file. These files are defined (without an explicitORGANIZATIONspecification) using theLINE ADVANCINGclause on theirSELECTstatement (see SELECT).
trans-unit.target: Estos son archivos con una estructura interna similar a la de un archivo secuencial de líneas. Estos archivos se definen (sin una especificación de ORGANIZATION explícita ) utilizando la cláusula LINE ADVANCING en su instrucción SELECT (ver SELECT ).

trans-unit.source: These are files with the simplest of all internal structures. Their contents are structured simply as a series of identically- or differently-sized data records, each terminated by a special end-of-record delimiter character. An ASCII line-feed character (hexadecimal 0A) is the end-of-record delimiter character used by any UNIX or pseudo-UNIX (MinGW, Cygwin, OSX) GnuCOBOL build. A truly native Windows build would use a carriage-return, line-feed (hexadecimal 0D0A) sequence.
trans-unit.target: Estos son archivos con la más simple de todas las estructuras internas.Su contenido se estructura simplemente como una serie de registros de datos de idéntico o diferente tamaño,cada uno terminado por un carácter especial de delimitador de fin de registro.Un carácter de línea ASCII (hexadecimal 0A)es el carácter delimitador de fin de registro utilizado por cualquier construcción GnuCOBOL de UNIX o pseudo-UNIX (MinGW,Cygwin,OSX).Una verdadera construcción nativa de Windows usaría una secuencia de retorno de carro,alimentación de línea (hexadecimal 0D0A).

trans-unit.target: Estos son subprogramas que están codificados como el único programa COBOL en su Unidad de Compilación (ver Unidad de Compilación ).

These default initialization rules can vary quite substantially from one COBOL implementation to another. For example, it is quite common for data division storage to be initialized to all binary zeros except for those data items where VALUE clauses are present. Take care when working with applications originally developed for another COBOL implementation to ensure that GnuCOBOL’s default initialization rules won’t prove disruptive.

These default initialization rules can vary quite substantially from one COBOL implementation to another. For example, it is quite common for data division storage to be initialized to all binary zeros except for those data items whereVALUEclauses are present. Take care when working with applications originally developed for another COBOL implementation to ensure that GnuCOBOL’s default initialization rules won’t prove disruptive.
trans-unit.target: Estas reglas de inicialización predeterminadas pueden variar sustancialmente de una implementación COBOL a otra. Por ejemplo, es bastante común que el almacenamiento de división de datos se inicialice a todos los ceros binarios, excepto para aquellos elementos de datos donde están presentes cláusulas VALUE . Tenga cuidado al trabajar con aplicaciones desarrolladas originalmente para otra implementación de COBOL para asegurarse de que las reglas de inicialización predeterminadas de GnuCOBOL no resulten disruptivas.

trans-unit.source: These devices (they are all synonymous) represent standard system input (pipe 0). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the keyboard. The contents of a file may be delivered to a GnuCOBOL program for access via one of these device names by adding the sequence "0< filename" to the end of the programs execution command.
trans-unit.target: Estos dispositivos (todos son sinónimos) representan la entrada estándar del sistema (tubería 0). En una PC o sistema UNIX, este suele ser el teclado. El contenido de un archivo puede entregarse a un programa GnuCOBOL para acceder a través de uno de estos nombres de dispositivo agregando la secuencia "0 <nombre de archivo" al final del comando de ejecución del programa.

trans-unit.source: These devices (they are all synonymous) represent standard system input (pipe 0). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the keyboard. The contents of a file may be delivered to a GnuCOBOL program for access via one of these device names by adding the sequence ‘

These devices (they are all synonymous) represent standard system output (pipe 1). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the display. Output sent to one of these devices by a GnuCOBOL program can be sent to a file by adding the sequence "1> filename" to the end of the programs execution command.
trans-unit.target: Estos dispositivos (todos son sinónimos) representan la salida estándar del sistema (tubería 1). En una PC o sistema UNIX, esta suele ser la pantalla. La salida enviada a uno de estos dispositivos por un programa GnuCOBOL se puede enviar a un archivo agregando la secuencia "1> nombre de archivo" al final del comando de ejecución del programa.

Output sent to one of these devices by a GnuCOBOL program can be sent to a file by adding the sequence "2> filename" to the end of the programs execution command.
trans-unit.target: Estos dispositivos (son sinónimos) representan la salida de error del sistema estándar (tubería 2). En una PC o sistema UNIX, esta suele ser la pantalla. La salida enviada a uno de estos dispositivos por un programa GnuCOBOL se puede enviar a un archivo agregando la secuencia "2> nombre de archivo" al final del comando de ejecución del programa.

These features allow fields to be displayed at specific row/column positions, various colors and video attributes to be assigned to screen fields and the pressing of specific function keys (F1, F2, …) to be detectable. All of this takes place through the auspices of the SCREEN SECTION (see SCREEN SECTION) and special formats of the ACCEPT statement (see ACCEPT) and the DISPLAY statement (see DISPLAY).

These features allow fields to be displayed at specific row/column positions, various colors and video attributes to be assigned to screen fields and the pressing of specific function keys (F1, F2, …) to be detectable. All of this takes place through the auspices of theSCREEN SECTION(see SCREEN SECTION) and special formats of theACCEPTstatement (see ACCEPT) and theDISPLAYstatement (see DISPLAY).
trans-unit.target: Estas características permiten que los campos se muestren en posiciones específicas de fila / columna, que se asignen varios colores y atributos de video a los campos de la pantalla y que la presión de teclas de función específicas (F1, F2,…) sea detectable. Todo esto tiene lugar a través de los auspicios de la SCREEN SECTION (consulte la SECCIÓN DE PANTALLA ) y formatos especiales de la declaración ACCEPT (consulte ACCEPT ) y la declaración DISPLAY (consulte DISPLAY ).

trans-unit.source: These files
trans-unit.target: Estos archivos

trans-unit.source: These files also have a simple internal structure. Their contents are structured simply as an arbitrarily-long sequence of data characters. This sequence of characters will be treated as a series of fixed-length records simply by logically splitting the sequence of characters up into fixed-length segments, each as long as the maximum record size defined in the program. There are no special end-of-record delimiter characters in the file and when the file is written to by a GnuCOBOL program, no delimiter sequence is appended to the data.
trans-unit.target: Estos archivos también tienen una estructura interna simple.Su contenido está estructurado simplemente como una secuencia arbitraria de caracteres de datos.Esta secuencia de caracteres será tratada como una serie de registros de longitud fija simplemente dividiendo lógicamente la secuencia de caracteres en segmentos de longitud fija,cada uno de ellos tan largo como el tamaño máximo de registro definido en el programa.No hay caracteres delimitadores especiales de fin de registro en el archivo y cuando el archivo es escrito por un programa de GnuCOBOL,no se añade ninguna secuencia delimitadora a los datos.

trans-unit.source: These files are files with an internal organization such that records may be processed in a sequential manner based upon their physical location in the file or in a random manner by allowing records to be read, written or updated by specifying the relative record number in the file.
These files can contain exact binary data fields. The contents of record fields are irrelevant to the reading process as there is no end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: Estos archivos pueden contener campos de datos binarios exactos.El contenido de los campos de registro es irrelevante para el proceso de lectura,ya que no existe un delimitador de fin de registro.

trans-unit.source: These files cannot be prepared with any standard text-editing or word processing software as all such programs will embed delimiter characters at the end of records (use ORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIAL instead).

These files cannot be prepared with any standard text-editing or word processing software as all such programs will embed delimiter characters at the end of records (useORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIALinstead).
trans-unit.target: Estos archivos no se pueden preparar con ningún software estándar de edición o procesamiento de texto, ya que todos estos programas incrustarán caracteres delimitadores al final de los registros (en su lugar, utilice ORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIAL ).

trans-unit.source: These files may be created with any standard text-editing or word processing software capable of writing text files. Such files should not contain any USAGE COMPUTATIONAL or BINARY (of any variety) data since such fields could accidentally contain byte sequences that could be interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.

These files may be created with any standard text-editing or word processing software capable of writing text files. Such files should not contain anyUSAGE COMPUTATIONALorBINARY(of any variety) data since such fields could accidentally contain byte sequences that could be interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: Estos archivos se pueden crear con cualquier software estándar de edición de texto o procesamiento de texto capaz de escribir archivos de texto. Dichos archivos no deben contener ningún dato de USAGE COMPUTATIONAL o BINARY (de cualquier variedad) ya que dichos campos podrían contener accidentalmente secuencias de bytes que podrían interpretarse como un delimitador de fin de registro.

trans-unit.source: These files may contain either USAGE DISPLAY or USAGE COMPUTATIONAL (of any variety) data since no binary data sequence can be accidentally interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
These files may contain eitherUSAGE DISPLAYorUSAGE COMPUTATIONAL(of any variety) data since no binary data sequence can be accidentally interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: Estos archivos pueden contener datos de USAGE DISPLAY o de USAGE COMPUTATIONAL (de cualquier variedad) ya que ninguna secuencia de datos binarios puede interpretarse accidentalmente como un delimitador de fin de registro.

trans-unit.source: These files should not be defined to contain any exact binary data fields because the contents of those fields could inadvertently have the end-of-record sequence as part of their values — this would confuse the runtime system when reading the file, and it would interpret that value as an actual end-of-record sequence.
trans-unit.target: Estos archivos no deben definirse para contener campos de datos binarios exactos porque el contenido de esos campos podría tener inadvertidamente la secuencia de fin de registro como parte de sus valores; esto confundiría al sistema de tiempo de ejecución al leer el archivo, e interpretaría ese valor como una secuencia real de fin de registro.

trans-unit.source: These groups will be presented (printed) across however many formatted pages are necessary to hold them. No single report group will be allowed to cross page boundaries.
trans-unit.target: Estos grupos se presentarán (impresos)en todas las páginas con el formato necesario para contenerlos.No se permitirá que un solo grupo de informe cruce los límites de las páginas.

trans-unit.source: These sizes conform to the COBOL standard and the minimum sizes of the COBOL types are the same as the minimum sizes of the corresponding C data types. There’s no official compatibility between them. Note that values in square braces ’[]’ are the defaults.

They conform to the principles of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP). This is desired for one major reason — it facilitates "code re-usability", thus improving the productivity of programmers by allowing them to re-use previously written (and debugged) code in new applications. For one reason or another, COBOL is perceived as being weak in this regard. It isn’t (especially today), as we’ll see in the next section, but perception is important.
trans-unit.target: Se ajustan a los principios de la programación orientada a objetos (OOP). Esto se desea por una razón importante: facilita la "reutilización del código", mejorando así la productividad de los programadores al permitirles reutilizar código previamente escrito (y depurado) en nuevas aplicaciones. Por una razón u otra, COBOL se percibe como débil a este respecto. No lo es (especialmente hoy), como veremos en la siguiente sección, pero la percepción es importante.

This behaviour when the argument is defined asPIC 9may be unacceptable, as an argument defined asPIC 9(3)but passed in a value of "1" from the command line will receive a value of "100", not "001". Consider defining "numeric" command line arguments asPIC Xand then using theNUMVALintrinsic function (see NUMVAL) function to determine the proper numeric value.
trans-unit.target: Este comportamiento cuando el argumento se define como PIC 9 puede ser inaceptable, ya que un argumento definido como PIC 9(3) pero pasado en un valor de "1" desde la línea de comando recibirá un valor de "100", no "001" . Considere definir argumentos de línea de comando "numéricos" como PIC X y luego usar la función intrínseca NUMVAL (ver NUMVAL ) para determinar el valor numérico adecuado.

This document describes the syntax, semantics and use of the COBOL programming language as implemented by GnuCOBOL, formerly known as OpenCOBOL.

trans-unit.source: This file organization was defined to accommodate either sequential or random processing. With a RELATIVE file, it is possible to read or write record 100 directly, without having to have first read or written records 1-99. The GnuCOBOL runtime system uses the program-defined maximum record size to calculate a relative byte position in the file where the record header and data begin, and then transfers the necessary data to or from the program.

This file organization was defined to accommodate either sequential or random processing. With aRELATIVEfile, it is possible to read or write record 100 directly, without having to have first read or written records 1-99. The GnuCOBOL runtime system uses the program-defined maximum record size to calculate a relative byte position in the file where the record header and data begin, and then transfers the necessary data to or from the program.
trans-unit.target: Esta organización de archivos se definió para adaptarse al procesamiento secuencial o aleatorio. Con un archivo RELATIVE , es posible leer o escribir el registro 100 directamente, sin tener que haber leído o escrito primero los registros 1-99. El sistema de tiempo de ejecución de GnuCOBOL utiliza el tamaño de registro máximo definido por el programa para calcular una posición relativa de byte en el archivo donde comienzan el encabezado del registro y los datos, y luego transfiere los datos necesarios hacia o desde el programa.

trans-unit.source: This first set of picture symbols defines the basic data type of a data item. Each symbol represents a single character’s worth of storage.
trans-unit.target: Este primer conjunto de símbolos de imagen define el tipo de datos básico de un elemento de datos. Cada símbolo representa el valor de almacenamiento de un solo carácter.

trans-unit.source: This form of the DISPLAY statement can be used to create or modify environment variables.

This form of the DISPLAY statement may be used to specify the command-line argument number to be retrieved by a subsequent ACCEPT FROM ARGUMENT-VALUE statement (see ACCEPT FROM COMMAND-LINE) or to specify a new value for the command-line arguments themselves.
This form of the GO TO statement unconditionally transfers control in a program to the first executable statement within the specified procedure-name-1.
This form of the GO TO statement will transfer control to any one of a number of specified procedure names depending on the numeric value of the identifier specified on the statement.
This form of the READ statement retrieves an arbitrary record from an ORGANIZATION RELATIVE (see ORGANIZATION RELATIVE) or ORGANIZATION INDEXED (see ORGANIZATION INDEXED) file.
This form of the READ statement retrieves the next (or previous) record from a file.
This form of the SET statement is used to turn switches on or off.
This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to read a value from the console window or the standard input device and store it into a data item (identifier-1).
This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve data from a formatted console window screen.
This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve environment variable values.
This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve information about the console window or about the user’s interactions with it.
This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve information from the program’s command line.
This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve run-time information such as the most-recent error exception code and the current user’s user name.
This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve the current system date, time or current day of the week and store it into a data item.
This format of the ACCEPT statement will be terminated by any of the following events:
This format of the ACCEPT statement will receive the status for any exceptions resulting from a previous valid verb.

This format of the ACCEPT statement will wait for a keyboard event that terminates input; function keys, or Enter/Return, among others. CRT STATUS (COB-CRT-STATUS CRT STATUS (see SPECIAL-NAMES) if not explicitly defined) is set with the keycode, listed in copy/screenio.cpy. It also handles a few other keycode terminations not normally used to complete an extended accept.

This format of the ADD statement generates an intermediate arithmetic sum of the values of all identifier-1 and literal-1) items. The value of each identifier-2 will be replaced, in turn, by the sum of that identifier-2s value and the intermediate sum.
This format of the ADD statement generates code equivalent to individual ADD TO (see ADD TO) statements for corresponding matches of data items found subordinate to the two identifiers.
This format of the ADD statement generates the arithmetic sum of the values of all identifier-1, literal-1) and identifier-2 (if any) items and then saves that sum to each identifier-3.
This format of the DISPLAY statement displays the specified identifier contents and/or literal values on the system output device specified via the UPON clause.
This format of the DISPLAY statement presents data onto a formatted screen.

This format of the DIVIDE statement will divide a numeric value (specified as a literal or numeric data item) into one or more numeric data items, replacing the value in each of those data items with the result(s).

This format of the DIVIDE statement will divide one numeric value (specified as a literal or numeric data item) into another numeric value (also specified as a literal or numeric data item) and will then replace the contents of one or more receiving data items with the results of that division.

This format of the PERFORM statement is identical in operation to the procedural PERFORM, except for the fact that the statement(s) comprising the perform scope (imperative-statement-1) (see Imperative Statement) are now specified in-line with the PERFORM code rather than in procedures located elsewhere within the program.

This format of the PERFORM statement is used to transfer control to one or more procedures, which will return control back when complete. Execution of the procedure(s) can be done a single time, multiple times, repeatedly until a condition becomes TRUE or forever (with some way of breaking out of the control of the PERFORM or of halting program execution within the procedure(s)).
This format of the SORT statement is designed to sort large volumes of data according to one or more key fields.
This format of the SORT statement sorts relatively small quantities of data — namely data contained in a data division table — according to one or more key fields.
This format of the SUBTRACT statement generates the arithmetic sum of all arguments that appear before the FROM (identifier-1 or literal-1) and subtracts that sum from each identifier-2.
This format of the VALUE clause may not be used anywhere in the description of an 01 item (or any of its subordinate items) serving as an FD or SD record description.
This format of theACCEPTstatement will be terminated by any of the following events:
trans-unit.target: Este formato de la declaración ACCEPT terminará por cualquiera de los siguientes eventos:

trans-unit.source: This format of theVALUEclause may not be used anywhere in the description of an 01 item (or any of it’s subordinate items) serving as anFDorSDrecord description.
trans-unit.target: Este formato de la cláusula VALUE no se puede utilizar en ninguna parte de la descripción de un elemento 01 (o cualquiera de sus elementos subordinados) que sirve como descripción de registro FD o SD .

trans-unit.source: This function Returns the date the GnuCOBOL program that is executing the function was compiled, in the form yyyymmdd.
This function computes and returns the factorial value of <var>number</var> (a numeric literal or data item).
This function concatenates the string-1, string-2, … (group items, USAGE DISPLAY elementary items and/or alphanumeric literals) together into a single string result.

This function converts <var>date</var> (a numeric integer data item or literal) — presumed to be a Gregorian calendar form standard date (YYYYMMDD) — to internal date form (the number of days that have transpired since 1600/12/31).

This function converts <var>date</var> (a numeric integer data item or literal) — presumed to be a Julian calendar form standard date (YYYYDDD) — to internal date form (the number of days that have transpired since 1600/12/31).
This function converts a string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal) representing a currency value to its corresponding numeric value.
This function converts a string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal) representing a floating-point value to its corresponding numeric value.
This function decodes the string <var>time</var> — whose value represents a formatted time — and returns the total number of seconds that string represents.
This function determines and returns the absolute value of <var>number</var> (a numeric literal or data item) supplied as an argument.
This function determines and returns the trigonometric sine of <var>angle</var> (a numeric literal or numeric data item).
This function determines and returns the trigonometric tangent of <var>angle</var> (a numeric literal or numeric data item).
This function determines if the supplied <var>date</var> (a numeric integer data item or literal) is a valid date.
This function determines if the supplied <var>date</var> argument (a numeric integer data item or literal) is a valid date.

This function evaluates string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal) for being appropriate for use as the string argument to a NUMVAL-C (see NUMVAL-C) function, returning to a integer a zero value if it is appropriate otherwise if one or more characters are in error, the position of the first character in error or the length of the field plus one for other cases such as all spaces.

This function evaluates string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal) for being appropriate for use as the string argument to a NUMVAL-F (see NUMVAL-F) function, returning to a integer a zero value if it is appropriate otherwise if one or more characters are in error, the position of the first character in error or the length of the field plus one for other cases such as all spaces.
This function parses <var>string</var>, replacing all occurrences of <var>from-n</var> strings with the corresponding <var>to-n</var> strings.
This function removes LEADING or TRAILING spaces from string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).

This function returns I/O exception information from the most-recently executed input or output statement. The information is returned as a 34-character string, where the first two characters are the two-digit file status value (see File Status Codes) and the remaining 32 are the file-name-1 specification from the file’s SELECT (see SELECT) statement.

This function returns a 12-digit numeric result, the first seven digits of which are the integer value of <var>days</var> argument (a numeric data item or literal) and the last five of which are the integer value of <var>seconds</var> argument (also a numeric data item or literal).

This function returns a calendar date in yyyyddd (i.e. Julian) format. The date is determined by adding the number of days specified as integer (a numeric integer data item or literal) to December 31, 1600. For example, DAY-OF-INTEGER(1) returns 1601001 while DAY-OF-INTEGER(250000) returns 2011251.
This function returns a numeric calendar date in

This function returns a numeric value approximating the ratio of an annuity paid at <var>interest-rate</var> (numeric data item or literal) for each of <var>number-of-periods</var> (numeric data items or literals).
This function returns a numeric value that is the remainder of <var>number</var> divided by <var>divisor</var>. Both arguments must be numeric data items or numeric literals.
This function returns a pseudo-random non-integer value in the range 0 to 1 (for example, 0.123456789).

This function returns exception information from the most-recently failing statement. The information is returned to a 1023 character string in one of the following formats, depending on the nature of the failure:

This function returns that portion of number (a numeric data item or a numeric literal) that occurs to the right of the decimal point. FRACTION-PART(3.1415), for example, returns a value of 0.1415. This function is equivalent to the expression:
This function returns the byte-by-byte reversed value of string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).

This function returns the character in the ordinal position specified by integer (a numeric integer literal or data item with a value of 1 or greater) from the COLLATING SEQUENCE (see OBJECT-COMPUTER) being used by the program.

This function returns the character used to separate the integer portion of a non-integer numeric item from the fractional part according to the rules currently in effect for the locale under which your program is running.

This function returns the character used to separate the thousands digit groupings of monetary currency values according to the rules currently in effect for the locale under which your program is running.
This function returns the character used to separate the thousands digit groupings of numeric values according to the rules currently in effect for the locale under which your program is running.
This function returns the current time of day expressed as the total number of elapsed seconds since midnight.
This function returns the error type (a text string — see column 2 of the upcoming table for the possible values) from the most-recent COBOL statement that generated an exception condition.

This function returns the full path to the executable version of this GnuCOBOL program. The filename component of this value will be exactly as typed on the command line, down to the use of upper- and lower-case letters and presence (or absence) of any extension.

This function returns the fully-formatted date and time when the program executing the function was compiled. The exact format of this returned string value may vary depending on the operating system and GnuCOBOL build type.

This function returns the highest (i.e. largest or farthest away from 0 in a positive direction if <var>numeric-identifier</var> is signed) value that could possibly be stored in <var>numeric-identifier</var>.
This function returns the length — in bytes of storage — of string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).

This function returns the lowest (i.e. smallest or farthest away from 0 in a negative direction if <var>numeric-identifier</var> is signed) value that could possibly be stored in <var>numeric-identifier</var>.
This function returns the mathematical constant
This function returns the maximum value from the specified list of numbers (each <var>number-n</var> may be a numeric data item or a numeric literal).
This function returns the minimum value from the specified list of numbers (each <var>number-n</var> may be a numeric data item or a numeric literal).
This function returns the most-recent COBOL statement that generated an exception condition.
This function returns the null string if it is executed within a main program. When executed with a subprogram, it returns the entry-point name of the program that called the subprogram.
This function returns the numeric value represented by the character string specified by <var>argument-1</var> and defined as alphanumeric.

This function returns the ordinal position in the argument list corresponding to the <var>char-n</var> whose 1<sup>st</sup> character has the highest position in the program collating sequence (usually <small>ASCII</small>).

This function returns the ordinal position in the argument list corresponding to the <var>char-n</var> whose 1<sup>st</sup> character has the lowest position in the program collating sequence (usually <small>ASCII</small>).

This function returns the ordinal position in the program character set (usually ASCII) corresponding to the 1st character of char argument (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).
This function returns the primary entry-point name (i.e. the PROGRAM-ID or FUNCTION-ID of the program. See IDENTIFICATION DIVISION, for information on those clauses.
This function returns the statistical mean value of the specified list of numbers (each <var>number-n</var> may be a numeric data item or a numeric literal).
This function returns the statistical median value of the specified list of numbers (each <var>number-n</var> may be a numeric data item or a numeric literal).
This function returns the statistical standard deviation of the list of <var>number-n</var> arguments (numeric data items or numeric literals).
This function returns the statistical variance of the specified list of <var>number-n</var> arguments (these may be numeric data items or numeric literals).
This function returns the time the GnuCOBOL program was compiled, in the form hhmmss.
This function returns the value of string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal), converted entirely to lower case.
This function returns the value of string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal), converted entirely to upper case.

This function returns the value of <var>value</var> modulo <var>modulus</var> (essentially the remainder from the division of <var>value</var> by <var>modulus</var>). Both arguments may be numeric data items or numeric literals. Either (or both) may have a non-integer value.

This is a single subprogram compiled into object-code form, ready to be linked in with a main program to form a directly-executable program. On windows computers, these generally are ".o" (object-code) files.
trans-unit.target: Es un único subprograma compilado en forma de código de objeto,listo para ser enlazado con un programa principal para formar un programa directamente ejecutable.En los ordenadores con Windows,generalmente son archivos ".o" (código de objeto).

trans-unit.source: This is an executable file directly-executable from the command-line. On Windows computers, this would be an

This is an executable file directly-executable from the command-line. On Windows computers, this would be an ".exe" file. On Unix systems, this will be a file with no specific extension, but with execute permissions. This file will include the main program as well as any static-linked subprograms.
trans-unit.target: Este es un archivo ejecutable directamente ejecutable desde la línea de comandos.En ordenadores con Windows,esto sería un archivo ".exe".En sistemas Unix,será un archivo sin extensión específica,pero con permisos de ejecución.Este archivo incluirá el programa principal,así como cualquier subprograma vinculado a la estática.

trans-unit.source: This is another obsolete area of COBOL statements. This part of every statement also hails back to the day when programs were punched on cards; it was expected that the name of the program (or at least the first 8 characters of it) would be punched here so that — if a dropped COBOL source deck contained more than one program — that handy card sorter machine could be used to first separate the cards by program name and then sort them by sequence number. Today’s COBOL compilers (including GnuCOBOL) simply ignore anything past column 72.
trans-unit.target: Esta es otra área obsoleta de las declaraciones COBOL. Esta parte de cada declaración también se remonta al día en que los programas se perforaban en tarjetas; Se esperaba que el nombre del programa (o al menos los primeros 8 caracteres del mismo) se marcaran aquí para que, si una plataforma fuente COBOL caída contenía más de un programa, esa práctica máquina clasificadora de tarjetas podría usarse para separar primero las tarjetas por nombre de programa y luego clasificarlas por número de secuencia. Los compiladores COBOL de hoy (incluido GnuCOBOL) simplemente ignoran cualquier cosa más allá de la columna 72.

trans-unit.source: This is the most advanced file structure available to GnuCOBOL programs. It’s not possible to describe the physical structure of such files because that structure will vary depending upon which advanced file-management facility was included into the GnuCOBOL build you will be using (Berkeley Database [BDB], VBISAM, etc.). We will — instead — discuss the logical structure of the file.

No es posible describir la estructura física de dichos archivos porque esa estructura variará dependiendo de qué función avanzada de administración de archivos se incluyó en la compilación de GnuCOBOL que usará (Berkeley Database [BDB], VBISAM, etc.). En cambio, discutiremos la estructura lógica del archivo.

trans-unit.source: This option allows one or more data items within one group item (<var>group-item-1</var> — the first named on the statement) to be paired with correspondingly-named (hence the name) in a second group item (<var>group-item-2</var> — the second named on the statement). The program name will be returned, left-justified and space filled, in prog-name-area argument, which should be a PIC X elementary item or a group item. If prog-name-area is too small to receive the entire program name, the program name value will be truncated (on the right) to fit.

This routine unpacks each bit of the single-byte data item <var>byte</var> into the low-order (rightmost) bit of each of the corresponding eight 1-byte items in <var>table</var>. The other seven bit positions of each of the first eight entries in <var>table</var> will be set to zero.

This section contains an example of the RWCS at work. The complete program, presented here, is a stripped-down version of a program I have used to generate a report for a class I teach on PC hardware. This report will provide benchmark statistics on a variety of popular AMD and Intel CPUs. The data for the report was obtained from the website www.cpubenchmark.net in December of 2013. By the time you are reading this, that data will most likely have become rather out of date, but it illustrates RWCS well enough.

This section contains an example of the RWCS at work. The complete program, presented here, is a stripped-down version of a program I have used to generate a report for a class I teach on PC hardware. This report will provide benchmark statistics on a variety of popular AMD and Intel CPUs. The data for the report was obtained from the website www.cpubenchmark.net in December of 2013. By the time you are reading this, that data will most likely have become rather out-of-date, but it illustrates RWCS well enough.
trans-unit.target: Esta sección contiene un ejemplo de la RWCS en funcionamiento. El programa completo, que se presenta aquí, es una versión simplificada de un programa que he usado para generar un informe para una clase que enseño sobre hardware de PC. Este informe proporcionará estadísticas de referencia sobre una variedad de CPU populares de AMD e Intel. Los datos para el informe se obtuvieron del sitio web www.cpubenchmark.net en diciembre de 2013. Para cuando esté leyendo esto, lo más probable es que esos datos estén bastante desactualizados, pero ilustran bastante bien a RWCS.

This statement exists within GnuCOBOL to provide compatibility with COBOL programs written to pre-1985 standards. The TRANSFORM statement was made obsolete in the 1985 standard of COBOL, having been replaced by the CONVERTING clause of the INSPECT statement (see INSPECT). New programs should be coded to use INSPECT CONVERTING rather than TRANSFORM.
